bmi_chart.title: Blood Pressure Overview
bmi_chart.description: Your blood pressure reading and recommended actions

low.title: Low Blood Pressure
low.summary: Your blood pressure is below normal range. While not always concerning, it's worth monitoring.

lifestyle.0: Wear compression stockings if recommended by your doctor

medical.0: Consult your healthcare provider if you experience dizziness, fainting, or fatigue
medical.1: Review current medications with your doctor

low.follow_up: Monitor blood pressure weekly and consult your doctor if symptoms persist.

normal.title: Normal Blood Pressure
normal.summary: Congratulations! Your blood pressure is in the normal range. Keep up the good work with healthy habits.

lifestyle.1: Limit sodium intake to less than 2,300mg per day
lifestyle.2: Exercise for at least 150 minutes per week
lifestyle.5: Get 7-9 hours of quality sleep nightly

medical.1: Maintain regular check-ups with your healthcare provider
medical.2: Keep track of any family history of hypertension

normal.follow_up: Recheck blood pressure annually or as recommended by your healthcare provider.

elevated.title: Elevated Blood Pressure
elevated.summary: Your blood pressure is elevated. This is a warning sign that you may develop high blood pressure without lifestyle changes.

lifestyle.0: Reduce sodium intake to less than 1,500mg per day
lifestyle.1: Increase physical activity to 30 minutes most days
lifestyle.2: Lose weight if overweight (even 5-10 pounds can help)

medical.0: See your healthcare provider within 3-6 months
medical.1: Discuss your family history and risk factors
medical.3: Monitor blood pressure at home regularly

elevated.follow_up: Recheck blood pressure in 3-6 months. If still elevated, discuss treatment options with your doctor.

high.title: High Blood Pressure
high.summary: You have Stage 1 high blood pressure. Immediate lifestyle changes and possibly medication are needed.

lifestyle.0: Reduce sodium to less than 1,500mg daily
lifestyle.1: Engage in 40 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise 3-4 times per week
lifestyle.2: Achieve and maintain a healthy weight
lifestyle.3: Quit smoking immediately if you smoke
lifestyle.6: Follow the DASH eating plan strictly

medical.0: Schedule an appointment with your healthcare provider within 1 month
medical.1: Discuss medication options with your doctor
medical.2: Assess for other cardiovascular risk factors
medical.4: Establish a treatment plan with your healthcare team

high.follow_up: Follow up with healthcare provider in 1 month to assess response to treatment.
